feed.title: Global Climate Summit Reaches Historic Carbon Agreement
feed.summary: World leaders gathered in Geneva have signed a landmark accord pledging to cut carbon emissions by 60% before 2040, with binding enforcement mechanisms for the first time in international climate law.

feed.title: Afrobeats Artist Burna Boy Drops Surprise Album 'Infinite Horizons'
feed.summary: The Grammy-winning artist released a 16-track surprise album at midnight, featuring collaborations with artists from Lagos, London, and Kingston. Streaming numbers broke records within hours of release.

feed.title: Tokyo Cherry Blossom Festival 2025: The Best Photos from Around the City
feed.summary: Thousands of photos flooded social media as Tokyo's Ueno Park erupted in full bloom two weeks ahead of schedule. Scientists attribute the early bloom to record winter temperatures across Honshu.

feed.title: AI Weekly Digest: Breakthroughs in Protein Folding and Medical Imaging
feed.summary: This week's AI-curated science digest covers DeepMind's new AlphaFold 3 update that models RNA interactions, a new radiology AI outperforming human specialists at early cancer detection, and open-source releases from Meta's FAIR lab.

feed.title: The Indicator: Why Central Banks Are Buying Gold at Record Rates
feed.summary: Central banks worldwide purchased over 1,000 tonnes of gold in 2024 â€” the highest in five decades. In this episode, economists break down what's driving the shift away from dollar reserves and what it means for everyday savers.
